website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you need a drill and bits for around-the-house projects, but keep in mind that it's not well-suited for heavy-duty drilling.
pros: In addition to the 20-volt drill/driver, this set has everything you need for drilling including battery, charger, and a large variety of bits
cons: Chuck may wobble, especially when drilling tough materials like solid wood

customer_reviews.title: You'll Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this drill as I had some home repair projects to do. I already had a B&D Trimmer, which I really like too. So I already had a few extra batteries for back-up. (never needed to use them). I have been pleasantly surprised at the torque power. The battery lasted over 4 hours, and was going strong when I had finished my project. This drill is not meant to build a house, but it sure is an excellent tool to have to do jobs around the house. The added bits are nice too. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: NAVY CHIEF

customer_reviews.title: Light yet very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly powerful. I used it to drill 3 inch deck screws into 2 inch cedar for 2 hours straight. While the unit will heat up over time, it cools down quickly. But more importantly, it is powerful enough to do that job well without any issues at all. I am totally satisfied with it. It is also more compact and lighter than the 18V Black & Decker I owned before. Yet outperforms that old 18V by a wide margin. Update: It has now been a year and this drill still performs like it did right out of the box. The battery keeps a charge for a long time too.
customer_reviews.author: JohnTop Contributor: Astronomy

customer_reviews.title: black and decker20v lithium drill?
customer_reviews.text: I. Was very sceptical at firstim a diehard dewalt person .but the price was right so I decided to take a chance and buy this black and decker drill to my surprise I put in 480 deck screws in a day and a half the first day I ran on the half charge it comes with that note I fully charged it it is so far a awesome drill and yes I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Brent LaFave

customer_reviews.title: This is a good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good drill, especially for the money, versus some of the bigger brand names and bigger prices for equivalent drills. I had vowed to ignore Black and Decker after the NiCad batteries proved to be such duds, but this model with the Lithium-Ion battery has good power, good battery life, and retains a charge for a fairly long time when shelved. I bought two of them as a result. So far the only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because the real test occurs over time and it's only been a few months of light usage so far.
customer_reviews.author: HopeThisHelps

customer_reviews.title: Can't hold the drill head straight. Drill head gets rusty.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality drill and drill head. The drill cannot hold the drill head straight. Whenever I drill a hole with it, the hole will turn out wider than the drill head because the head is not straight and when it rotates, it will open a wider hole that the diameter of the head. The head is of poor quality, too. As shown in the picture, the drill gets rusty after only a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Bowen Zhao

customer_reviews.title: Single-use battery
customer_reviews.text: I charged the battery and used the drill for one small project shortly after I bought this drill. I didn't have much planned for it, I just took advantage of a good sale price to have a drill on hand for future use. Flash forward 7 months to the next project and the battery is completely dead and will not take a charge. The sale price wasn't worth the 10 minutes I got out of this. I'm looking for the manufacturer/warranty paperwork to see what I need to do to get this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Pratt

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY: This is likely a knock-off - mine caught on fire after six days.
customer_reviews.text: My Black&Decker 20V Drill caught on fire after 6 days of use. I used it for less than 30 min a day for the first five days, and after charging the battery overnight, I tried to use the drill and it did not work (just beeped). After about 4 seconds, significant amounts of smoke started pouring out of the motor, melting the plastic. Please be careful with this. Please be careful if you purchase this product, it may catch on fire.
customer_reviews.author: ssegal

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one but I’m missing some thing
customer_reviews.text: I can’t attached the attachments to drill anything something is missing and I have furniture on the way that I have to put together myself I order the drill to get the job done!!! This is ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.author: Yellie

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Nice drill! Was able to drill holes on my ceramic pots with a drill bit I bought. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Q

customer_reviews.title: Not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: As a woman, I like this drill vs our previous ones. Never noticed how heavy those were until I lifted this one! Seems to have good power - at least for what I will use it for - light household use. Can't comment on the battery life, since we just got it.
customer_reviews.author: Reg

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED IN THE QUALITY - VERY CHEAP PLASTIC
customer_reviews.text: The drill is very plastic and cheap looking, I was very surprised at how cheap things are made these days. I can see that this drill isn’t made to last, one drop and the plastic will break apart, I’m very disappointed in Black + Decker and their diminished quality. PROS: The drill works and is adjustable. CONS: Very cheap looking drill and certainly not worth the price they charged. The bottom line is that you might be better off spending a few dollars more and get a drill that’s more durable.
customer_reviews.author: BOOKEM

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh.......
customer_reviews.text: Well - I thought we were getting a crazy deal cause this was an Amazon prime day deal. Turns out Walmart sells this same item for the price we got it on Amazon. So buyer beware. It works just fine. If you are planning on doing heavy drilling and you are using a Black and Decker product it's your fault it isn't as powerful as you thought. Don't be dumb and think this is "heavy duty." It's not. Its a black and decker product. However for light work its great to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Rob and Mark

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item. It has little power. Better to spend a bit more money on a better model.
customer_reviews.author: ehansen

customer_reviews.title: Cheapo
customer_reviews.text: When drilling into a wood fence slat I noticed that I had to push hard against the bit to get it to dig into the wood. Then the drill bit I was using got stuck and dislodged from the chuck. I have not been able to remove the drill bit but I am sure that my corded driver will get it put presto. It seems like a cheapo driver. I do not think I will keep it. Can't get the job done with a tool like this.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: This power drill/driver works fine for light use
customer_reviews.text: This power drill/driver works fine for light use. However, I felt that it is not very sturdy. For example, when I put one of the drill bits shipping with it, I can easily see that it wiggles a little bit when the drill is working. I tried as much as I can to make sure that it is placed correctly but it always wiggles. Also, all the screw-driver tips are not magnetic which might make it harder to use with screws as they might fall down. Nonetheless, given its price, it is OK for minor use for small house projects.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Eldawy

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner drill
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned or even used a drill before, and this one was pretty easy to catch on wirh. I think good for beginners. Comes with everything you need except a carrying case which would have made this above and beyond- but still this is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: bitterswtmocha

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS GOOD FOR DRILLING THROUGH BRICK
customer_reviews.text: I just got around to using this drill! Glad it worked as I am out of the return window. However, it really gets the job done! I actually bought it cause I have some Ring spot cams I bought off of Amazon and I never used them cause I needed to drill into the brick. It comes with bits you need, but obviously if you need any other, you can always buy them from Home Depot. I will say for me, it was a bit heavy, but that could also be because this was the first time I ever drilled anything. I would recommend this product as it’s easy enough for a newbie like me to get it to work!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: I'm no handyman
customer_reviews.text: I'm no handyman, but this drill is good enough for me. I'm not doing any serious work, just some small home projects here and there. It worked out well though, because I had just purchased a new weed trimmer and leaf blower combo from Black & Decker and the batteries are universal, so that's the best part. Now I have four batteries always ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: drilling is thrilling.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first drill I’ve ever owned and I couldn’t be more satisfied. Being an independent, single millennial woman - damn, I feel empowered holding this bad boy in my hands knowing I’m a few screws away from a cool shelf, hanging rack or plant stand. Drilling is thrilling and everyone should grab one of these. I wish a drill bit organizer was included or it came in a carrying bag/box. Still it’s worth five stars for the value and product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenpen

customer_reviews.title: Drillin through Quarantine
customer_reviews.text: This drill has been a savior to my quarantine boredom. It came with an entire set of bits and drill bits which along with the drill itself is a steal. I have already used it to build a shelf, ladder, makeshift water can, and a compost bin. I have yet to see how long the battery last since I have only charged it once and haven't needed to do it again. Its not the lightest weight if you are staying in one position for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Marley Maybee

customer_reviews.title: Works for small jobs like studs. Wouldn't get it if for drilling into wood/harder surfaces often.
customer_reviews.text: This has been really handy for small DIY jobs such as installing hooks/shelves into wall studs. The drill isn't super powerful, so you have to take a bit more care than just blindly pressing it as hard as you can into a wall stud. Even at the highest setting you may need to run the drill slowly or press slowly on anything thicker/stronger than drywall. Similarly, works as a screwdriver but but for things that need an extra little bit of torque I've done 90% of the job with the drill, and then used a regular screwdriver for the last few turns.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Coates

customer_reviews.title: Power tools and I do not go together.
customer_reviews.text: With that said, the cordless drill did the job. I bought it because I finally wanted handles on my kitchen cabinets. No matter what I did, I couldn't make a hole with a hammer and nail. Who knew my cabinet doors were so tough? Anyway, with one charge and over multiple days, I finally finished installing all 26 cabinet pulls. Each one required two screws. It was so easy! My only complaint is that for all of us never-used-a-power tool before, please include in your directions how to put the drill bit into the thing! I had to ask a friend of mine. Felt pretty dumb since it was so simple.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Dad Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad as we have been doing a lot of summer home improvement and he is very impressed. We put up a whole new fence on the side of our home using this drill and we have had no problems. It is very lightweight, easy to use, and the battery lasts a long time. Definitely recommend for any home improvement type projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kilo man

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: this is my first drill. I've used it for a wide range of home improvement projects, including building a 6 ft privacy fence. I still haven't needed to charge the battery. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel O

customer_reviews.title: OK for light duty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a light duty replacement for my Skill drill that is no longer serviceable due to battery style change. Overall feel is a bit Generic, light tin weight and plastic feeling. Power output is fully acceptable, battery charge time so far is over the top. Big downfall is the Cheap low quality chuck that allows bits to slip when tight, unless bit is triple sided for proper grip in chuck. Included drill bits are good for aluminum of plastic, not any type of steel, other included attachments are OK, but lesser quality in function as compared to other brands. For the price; it's fine and overall function; except chuck are good.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough!
customer_reviews.text: I just moved and needed some power to install curtain rods, closet rods, hang pictures, medicine cabinets, etc. This does the job beautifully! I just wish it had a latch to go flatter. There are times that the design makes me have to do things at a weird angle. I just wish it was like a Stapler, going flat, instead of always in a set position! I charged it at the get-go and still running after many hours of using it! I love it! Much better than my Cordless screwdriver!
customer_reviews.author: Josie from USA

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a beginner so it took me a while to figure out how to put the drills in but it was very easy to figure out! Very great drill, it gets the job done! I would recommend for small jobs in your house:)
customer_reviews.author: Rose S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small tasks
customer_reviews.text: Great drill for small maintenance work or tasks for your average Joe/Jane. I used it to drill holes to set up curtains, with the holders going into wood and drywall. It's a bit hard to get it through the drywall without pushing but overall it works well although I don't think it's going to be powerful enough for more serious work (but I could be wrong). The box does come with plenty of bits though so at least you have options.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely positively the worst piece of **** tool you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage for any DIY projects. The power and torque is comparable to a small child’s toy ... if you are planning to use this drill for anything more than drilling a couple screws into a toy, don’t buy. Save your money and buy a real piece of equipment ... spend the extra $50 and buy yourself a Dewalt or Milwaukee brand, you’ll thank me later. Don’t make the same mistake I did and buy this cheap piece of s***. Save up and buy yourself a real man tool.
customer_reviews.author: caitertater17

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Good value. I've used this drill at least twice a week in the past month. I would reccomend this product to anyone moving into a new home who doesnt already have a tool set. Good product, good price for intermittent home use. The drill bits leave a LOT to be desired. I wouldn't use them for anything other than soft wood at most. I've bent one of them trying to drill through a small piece of aluminum. The centering point on the drill, however, is nice for minumal woodwork. 9/10. Good torque also. Adjustable by hand. I would suggest buying a drill bit set. (I work in a machine Shop, so I'm good.)
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: ordered this in december billed in february
customer_reviews.text: The product was fine. I am displeased because I ordered the product in December, in an order with multiple items. The transaction looked as though full payment went through on the date of the order transaction, but only a partial payment was transacted to my credit card. In February I noticed new charges on my credit card which I found suspicious. I did not think I made these transactions because I ordered these items in December, received the ordered items in December and fully paid off my bill from December when it was due in January. To make this simple, I do not like the delay in the credit card transaction billing, its confusing.
customer_reviews.author: kelli d.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my first drill!
customer_reviews.text: This drill was bought to create holes in containers for my succulents that did not already have holes. This is my first drill and happy with ease of use, weight, and it gets the job done. The plastic containers used the corkscrew tips that came with the kit and worked great to create these drainage holes. I bought an additional diamond tip set to use with this drill to create holes in the ceramic containers.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Willow Marie

customer_reviews.title: More Power, faster!
customer_reviews.text: This kit arrived with the battery at 90% so if necessary I could have used it right out of the box. I didn't, I followed the instructions to ensure battery life as long as possible. This is my daughter's drill. Yeah, I was surprised wen she said rather than paying for the storage this month, she wanted a drill of her own. The included attachments will all come in handy, and I'm sure she will use it carefully. It's lighter than a similar model I had from 2008. The batteries died and would not hold a charge, so this was our choice. So far, I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: powerful and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I love it so much I bought 2 more for gifts. It makes a great house warming gift. Friends loved it. My neighbor borrowed it and was impressed with it and was suppized how powerful it was. Even with my carpool tunnel, tendinitis and bursitis I have no trouble using it. Ive been building a 16' cat run and 8'x10' catio. I can only work few hrs at a time, so its difficult to say how long a charges lasts. I charge it up every 4-5 days. Eventhough I think one charge may last 6 -8hrs I recommend buying extra batteries if u plan to use it for big prodjects
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Nice powerful drill for the money
customer_reviews.text: I need a drill /driver to put in several hundred 2 and a half inch screws in my creaking plywood floor before installing flooring over it. This drill/driver had no problem with that task and the included bits came in very handy. The battery last a long time before needing a charge. Very good deal for the price! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Robitaille

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how impressed I am with this drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 10 y/o 12v Black & Decker cordless drill. I also have a wedding registry with a more expensive DeWalt 20v drill on there as well. This was intended to carry me through until someone bought me the DeWalt. But this drill has really impressed me. I have used it thus far to build and mount a headboard, dog bowl stand, and finishing up some urban gardens for our apartment porch. I have charged it once to do all of those projects -- a significant improvement over my 12v model. If you're looking for a cheaper drill that can handle a wide variety of wood projects with relative ease, this is the drill for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR FIRST TIME HOMEOWNER
customer_reviews.text: This little drill has been a godsend! I've been able to use it to install all of my wooden blind, put together furniture, and so much more. It's quick and easy to change out the different tool pieces to take care of whatever home project I am working on. It has a good sturdy feel to it but not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good balance of value vs. cost
customer_reviews.text: For me the challenge when buying a tool is always how much I want to spend vs how powerful/long lasting the tool is going to be. This is right in the sweet spot for someone who wants a drill for medium sized projects or minor cabinetry. It's powerful enough to do pretty much anything a non-professional would want to do, and the battery life isn't bad (though if you're using it a lot an extra pack would be wonderful). One very minor point: the bits that come with it are just OK - a great set to start with but you're probably going to want to replace/buy nicer of the most common bits eventually.
customer_reviews.author: CamilleThomas

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Thing!
customer_reviews.text: My co-worker had one that I was eyeing for a while. I finally bought it and knew almost immediately that this was a great purchase. I tightened up all the loose screws in my house in cabinet doors, etc. It's powerful and keeps the charge for long periods. For example, my coworker left his drill in the office during the pandemic. When we were finally let back into the office, his drill was still almost fully charged. It's not too heavy, so it's easy to handle. Best buy ever!
customer_reviews.author: CEAUK

customer_reviews.title: Achieve your DIY goals with this
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I’ve been wanting to own a drill for forever, but the prices always stopped me. I didn’t know enough about drills to know what I needed. But I trust the brand name, like the price, and love that it includes all the accessories! I’ve already hung so many heavy decorative things on my walls and installed a new toilet paper holder. I’m basically one project away from hosting my own DIY show thanks to this drill. Living my best life.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi G

customer_reviews.title: Great for a first drill as far as I can tell
customer_reviews.text: This is my first drill purchase. I'm knocking off one star because it was missing the bit I needed and instead has two of the next size up. It worked out and that size did the job so not a huge deal. Kind of annoying though. Aside from that, considering I've never purchased, owned, or used a drill before, I was able to get my new curtain rod up relatively easy and I look forward to find some more home jobs to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cobalt Chameleon

customer_reviews.title: This is gonna make confinement at home sooo much better!
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect tool to avoid blisters when putting together a ton of shelving and storage cabinets i haad been putting off for being on the road and so busy 24/7 for the last 20 years! I'm sure it even boosted my testosterone levels as any good tool does no? suffice to say that my wife no longer thinks i'm lazy, yes i know a lot of us confuse tired and weary for lazy but deep down inside we know the difference right!? yould need to get yourself some additional bits for it but it's a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles
customer_reviews.text: Unhappy with this drill. The drill bits wobbled so much we could not accurately do any precise drilling. We returned the drill immediately and purchased another more expensive, different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Meryl

customer_reviews.title: very useful and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and use them a lot. The unit is well-designed, well-made, and ready to use anywhere due to Li-ion battery power. This unit, and other B+D battery tools, can use batteries from any, and much cheaper, sources as long as they have the proprietary B+D type connections. The same batteries with different proprietary connection patterns are available for other brands -- they are not interchangeable. Non B+D sources can also provide larger batteries which are preferable if you use the tool very much. I can definitely recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. DeBruin

customer_reviews.title: Tools for a woman.
customer_reviews.text: Best starter tool for a person who has never used power tools and don’t know what they are doing. I bought this to do little home projects and it has helped out so much. I’m just glad if I break this I didn’t spend too much money but also the fact that I’m New to the power tool game so I have nothing to compare it too.
customer_reviews.author: shante

customer_reviews.title: What a Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect drill for basic household chores. It comes with a number of drill bits, and the battery life lasts a long time. It’s easy to use, easy to store (although it doesn’t come with a bag or box to store it in), and light weight. Wouldn’t recommend if you have a bigger project or need more power, but the smaller projects or drilling for hanging pictures it’s ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Cordless Drill / Driver with 30-Piece Accessories (LD120VA)
customer_reviews.text: Battery seems to last forever. Nice not having cord - or - need to locate electrical outlet - and being able to use anywhere. Nice torque - able to extract old screws - circa 1984 - to start rebuild of back porch steps. Also installed solar LED lights around home - handy with the portable battery drill. Good assortment of bits and drills - THANKS Should have ordered the optional carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg A. Moser

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight-picture hanging only.
customer_reviews.text: Good as a basic cordless screwdriver. Hung two whiteboards with it and loved it. Tried to hang a monitor wall mount which required more torque and it failed. It just doesn’t have the juice for anything more than a lightweight job. Nothing sadder than seeing a screw 1/3 into the wall and hearing your drill click. Gonna have to give up on wall mounted monitors or buy a second drill.
customer_reviews.author: 7twists

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: For a Black and Decker product this drill was terrible. If there was any pressure on the drill pit the drill would stop. I returned the drill after using it twice the first week. Even fully charged the drill did not function properly. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ronniekay

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't even drill into a wood stud, not enough power. I bought this drill to mount a tv and anchor some cabinets and I tried multiple studs and the drill couldn't go further than half an inch into the wall. It would not even penetrate the stud. Yes I was using the correct drill bit and no I was not drilling into a metal plate or pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: great drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: B&D isnt exactly the best brand of power tools, but this drill get the job done if its just stuff around the house. ive done a bunch of home projects using this drill. where you rest your thumb can scratch your knuckle a bit, just be careful, its right where the two pieces of plastic that make up the drill meet and its not always a seamless connection. overall, you wont find a better drill with this many drill bits for this price. Great for drilling on a budget, like a $20 prostitute, just use (hand) protection
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It works, jams ocassionally
customer_reviews.text: It's light weight, the battery lasts and lasts, and it works. I have had issues with the check sticking and locking my bit in place. Oddly a few youtube videos suggested gently tapping on the top of the chuck. This fixes it immediately. I'm a little concerned about that part but for the price and since it resolves itself easily I'm happy using this drill.
customer_reviews.author: Winston&co

customer_reviews.title: It’s a drill!
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had come with a case. Otherwise, it’s perfect for around the house.
customer_reviews.author: NaNiNa

customer_reviews.title: Disposable drill
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband for Father’s Day. During his second attempted use it broke! Stopped working. Notified Amazon but missed the cutoff day by three days. They referred me to black and decker. They spoke to spoke one there and then told me that someone from black and decker was going to be reaching out to me. I’m still waiting, three weeks later. Honestly loosing hope by now. I’m guessing I bought a disposable $50 drill. ONE TIME USE! Pretty disappointing!!!
customer_reviews.author: My3BOYS

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a tool guy
customer_reviews.text: So this doesn't see heavy use and may pale in comparison to higher quality brand name tools, but this probably has been one of my most useful purchases in a long time. Very affordable drill when I bought it, doesn't see heavy use but when it has been very handy when I've needed it and am always glad I got it when those situations arise. Haven't had any problems with battery life and it's pretty light weight too.
customer_reviews.author: CodeRedAddictMD

customer_reviews.title: For your average household
customer_reviews.text: This is a small power tool compared to others. So I wouldn’t considered a big project based tool. Though, it’s perfect for your average household doing simple drilling into walls to assembling furniture.
customer_reviews.author: YimYorm

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly drill, do not get it.
customer_reviews.text: The worst part about this drill is that it wobbles a lot. It really screwed up all the jobs I was doing and it is not a great experience for I am never purchasing Black and Decker products again. Please don't waste your money on this, there are a lot better drills out there. I will try to post a video here. This drill is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This drill set has pretty much everything you need for beginners. It is easy to use, battery life is above average, and the entire set makes it a great price point. I am docking off one star because I wish it was slightly more powerful but I guess for the price point, I can’t ask for more right? Also wished the drill bits were magnetic so screws will attach itself easily.
customer_reviews.author: adelu

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill. Anyone who bought it thinking it was a hammer drill for concrete or other harsh jobs doesn't understand what they're doing. If you want a hammer drill for concrete, buy one! It does a great job for all normal jobs. Specialty jobs require specialty tools. Don't be dissuade by amateur reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Camp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drill with a surprisingly small profile and I'm able ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome drill with a surprisingly small profile and I'm able to fit it in my cabinet with drill bit to install some shelves. The power was way more than what I was expecting which was a nice surprise. The accessories are great and saves me money in going to buy separate drill bits. For the prices, it's a great deal and it's definitely useful for little things around the house.
customer_reviews.author: ssj_100

customer_reviews.title: Was quite impressive...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect LOL this is my first drill. I don't even recall really using one. This was quite impressive to use as in a single weekend I used it to uninstall and reinstall new door locks and put up a bunch of curtains. I also used the drill bits... quite exciting!!! I'm not sure if I would ever need this for anything crazy since I'm not much of a "builder" but this works for me. The battery lasted all day... didn't even know if I needed to recharge every night but I did just in case. It comes with one battery, one charger, drill bits, and the attachment for screws.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Every now and then, not daily
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about power tools. I bought this to help build a bunch of ikea furniture. The battery has lasted me for days of usage (but I'm not using it 24-7). I would recommend this to someone who needs this for a few things now and then not for someone who would use it daily. It's probably a good power tool for beginners but not someone who works in construction.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to hang some curtain rods up. It was quick and easy. I had tried to install by hand and it just wasn't cutting it. The tip magnet holds the screw in place while working as well and the different levels of power come in handy. I used it for minimal stuff and it is definitely handy to have around. Def happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Replaced old model of same drill
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that Lowes doesn't seem to carry Black and Decker anymore so I replaced my old B&D 20v drill on Amazon. The exterior box was all torn up, barely held together, when it arrived but the interior box was fine. Drill worked great. The plastic is different on the new one. Lighter? Cheaper? Not sure what, but different.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fits 7 1/2" W x 20" L toolbox
customer_reviews.text: Don't need tools living in an apartment per say, but I have a toolbox that's stocked with the basics. It works fine for anything you could ever do in an apartment. In a garage, and being a machinist etc. I'd say it will drill any metal you need to drill just fine. It can withstand heavy use for about 2 hours probably.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L. Wendel

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill set
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few days and am very pleased with it. It is perfect for projects around the house and comes with all the accessories you might need for those projects. Sturdy and lightweight and bonus that it's cordless. I don't mind that it didn't come with a case because it performs well and has everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Chewie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: I tried out the drill the same day that I received it and the 1/8 drill bit snapped in two. The break off damaged my walls a bit. Just a warning for buyers, the accessories are not covered by the warranty so I guess you can consider this my loss. It’s rather ridiculous for it to break on the first use though.
customer_reviews.author: Pyon

customer_reviews.title: Great for Light home use
customer_reviews.text: We aren’t the very professional DIY types but there are some things around the house we can do. It’s essential to have a reliable drill that works. This does the job! It came obviously brand new with tape on either side to confirm that. It has a rechargeable batterY and is cordless. Works for us. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CC✨👩🏻‍🍳✨

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is better than what i expected
customer_reviews.text: The power is good enough for basic wall mounting TVs and Assembling TV Stands throughout a few hours battery life for me lasted through my whole home theater installation wall mounting my 65 inch Q9FN and my Z9F sound bar with Rear Speakers along with a new entertainment center to clean up all my cables in the back which took a total of 3 hours to do including preparation and clean up
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research for the right home drill, I am impressed great power easy to use good price with extra bits and drills that would not have come with if purchased locally
customer_reviews.author: Chad A. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Pros Great battery life Ease of use Powerful Cons No led lighht included No magnetic tips Hard to reach deeper places or where scrrws are adjacent to a surface
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY 👍
customer_reviews.text: Omg I love it! I’m a girl and Of course there is always something that needs to be done at home and a regular screwdriver is not enough. I love this drill! This is my first drill and it’s very easy to use and very efficient. I actually used it to build a cabinet for at least four hours and the battery did not die. This is a very cool drill and it comes with all these accessories. This is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Swap out your tool
customer_reviews.text: After my ex husband left me I needed to replace the tools he took that I would normally use. Our drill was nice but he bought it and it was a little heavy for me so after tons of review reading I picked this one and I love it. It’s got that power and it’s light and I can buy other tools that use th same battery. Win win. Got ride of a big tool and replaces it with a better one 😉
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: smoking brand, need a less hot item!
customer_reviews.text: had to return it for fear of my life, the thing shot sparks and flames out the back end whenever first turned it on, it did not look like it was suppose to do that! so called CS that nite and they had me box it up right there& then told me to return it and dont turn it back on at all ,so I did and they returned my money so I could try buying another brand or the same, I think I'll try another brand! blk& decker use to be the NAME NRAND you wanted, but I believe ill find another brand! lol
customer_reviews.author: terry b.

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February used it like four times and the thing sparks with flames now. It’s past the return window so I’m stuck. Don’t make the same mistake I did?
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy it sooner?
customer_reviews.text: As first I was nervous, never have use drill machine before. I have been using hammer and nail. First time using it and I am impressed. Totally worth it. Battery came in charged. Life just got easier. I have some project in my mind, i think I can do it with this drill machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jamy

customer_reviews.title: Nice cordless drill/driver.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this drill/driver and it made quick work of installing privacy screens onto our deck by driving 2.5 inch srews into wood. I don't know about battery life yet since I just got it - but it worked well today. I do wish it had come with a small case of some kind to keep the drill and all the bits and instructions together so I don't lose anything.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come with all pieces
customer_reviews.text: I received this before a move and it’s a GREAT drill. HOWEVER, make sure you get all the pieces they say comes with it. I didn’t receive any of the drill bits and will he calling the manufacture to get them bc that’s the biggest reason I needed this tool to move and be able to install things in my new place. REALLY frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for?  maybe not so much
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have the massive torque of my old Craftsman, but as I'm aging I was looking for something more lightweight and easy to use. This fills the bill. Addendum: I spoke too soon. Three days after using the charging unit to charge up the batteries it went into crazy mode. I have returned the entire outfit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: B&D
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill because it's allowed me to put up seven sets of horizontal blinds with a swiftness that has amazed me. The price was on point also
customer_reviews.author: timesplitter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drill!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite new thing! I'm a new homeowner, also a single mom and this thing was so easy to learn even for someone who had no idea how to do it! Get it, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need to be strong
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this yet. I got stuck just trying to charge it. It seems obvious, but I couldn't get it to snap in the charger. I finally asked a maintenance man for help. I was doing it right, but I just wasn't strong enough to push the parts together. The next question is whether I am strong enough to hold the weight steady when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this when we bought our new home. Our previous drill we had had for years, but it was not a drill/driver. This product was the best rated and it did not disappoint. Not only is it lighter than our previous drill but it is also has a longer battery life. I have put up over 6 sets of drapes and blinds without a hitch. This is a product I would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two days
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this drill, but unfortunately it stopped working for me after maybe 2 days - total working time just a few hours. If all you are doing is hanging pictures or minor things like that, then it will probably work for you just fine. If you are doing heftier work like framing, furniture making, etc - then there is too great a risk it will fail.
customer_reviews.author: Agallard

customer_reviews.title: Holds up pretty well. Not sure if this would work for ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a much crappier drill before this, and the battery would never hold a charge to complete my very simple tasks. This puppy works no problems, and I don't have to charge it after every use. Holds up pretty well. Not sure if this would work for heavy duty daily work, but for simple homeowner tasks, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to save my arthritic thumb.  So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd had this long ago. I'm the handywoman in our family, the one who does most of the repairs and I'm always drilling and setting screws. While building raised garden beds, I noticed my thumb was throbbing most of the time. This is a game changer!
customer_reviews.author: Linda from Santa Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Delivered without a battery/power pack.
customer_reviews.text: The cordless drill delivered without Power Pack/Battery. I ordered this item and had it shipped to me all the way in Nigeria only for it to arrived with the Power Pack/Battery. What do I do now as the drill is quite useless without a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Toyedayo

customer_reviews.title: Meets all our needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect drill for home projects. Easy to hold, excellent power and stores easily. Being used in a townhouse for fixing furniture, hanging pictures and assembling furniture. Meets all our needs. Look forward to adding more tools that use the same battery includng lawn tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jtaylo

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill for casual diy
customer_reviews.text: Certainly not a drill for someone to use making a living building things but rest assured it is a quality tool for the money. I purchased this for my oldest son for Christmas a few years back and was informed this Christmas it was still going strong. Lightweight but powerful it seems to hold a charge well and even after this amount of time I was informed both batteries are still in good working order.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Wbat a little gem!
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I used a different brand that was large and not easy to handle, and the battery did not last long at all. This one is so very perfect for home use. It is small, powerful enough for most jobs, and easy to handle. Battery life is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: H. K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and perfect for projects
customer_reviews.text: Having bought our first house it was time for my fiance to get his first power drill. This has been perfect around the house and small projects on our pool deck. We never realized just how much we needed it until we got it. It is light, easy to use, comes with lots of pieces to change out and it hasn't died during any projects, although one day we will get a second battery just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles a lot just like other reviewers posted
customer_reviews.text: This is my first drill bit so I wasn't aware of what to look for when I got the item. Later I realized that it's wobbly. With so much wobble, the holes were not being drilled correctly. It was larger than it was supposed to be. Returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself-er
customer_reviews.text: I’m a young petite woman who decided to renovate a house, for back story. I also like to do as much as I can independently both for satisfaction and learning purposes. I knew I needed some power tools but also needed something that wouldn’t break the bank or my arm. This checked both boxes while working wonderfully to get my jobs done.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice little drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little drill. Previously I was using a Dewalt 18v but I got tired of spending so much on the brand. I bought this as an alternative and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great for driving screws, not sure about drilling
customer_reviews.text: I use this for assembling furniture, mainly driving screws which it does a great job at. For drilling holes it doesn't seem particularly powerful, not under-powered, but just average. But it's cheap so I can't complain. I like this drill quite a bit for driving screws but maybe it doesn't cut it for drilling harder woods.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for medium to small projects
customer_reviews.text: Great for household DIY. Enough torque for indoor use but probably not enough for larger projects. It’s missing a light and a level in this model. If I were to buy again I would upgrade to these extra features. Had B&D before and it always lives up to its claims.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Who knew small could be so cool?
customer_reviews.text: When i got this it was smaller and more light weight than i expected. But...it works! I am handicapped and this is something i could handle!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done, but needs to be tightened often
customer_reviews.text: I needed a drill to put together furniture, hang shelves, etc. and bought this one on sale. I'm happy with it. The battery lasts a very long time! The thing that holds the drill/screw bits comes loose often and needs to be tightened constantly. Overall, I think it's a decent drill for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 months, 2 months after that still waiting for replacement
customer_reviews.text: I am not at all a power user of tools. I was simply hanging some shelves and the direction lock broke, then it somehow would not even unscrew to all you to change the bit. I contacted Black & Decker to get a replacement and 2 months later I am still waiting for the replacement to arrive. I think this may be on of the worst experiences I have had with customer service. They lied to me at various points about what the status was and how long the replacement would take to arrive. I will never buy from this company again and I grew up using their tools. I can't believe how bad this experience was.
customer_reviews.author: James Ziegenfuss

customer_reviews.title: Powerful light weight drill
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how small it was when it came in the mail, but I absolutely love this drill. Light weight yet powerful and the battery life is great. We were installing 15 blinds and 5 ceiling fans in a new house and it lasted fine. I love how small/light it is. But I didn’t have any problem drilling into a stud. You can adjust the power so that it won’t go too powerful when you are screwing the screws in a ceiling fan blades. I wish it came with the carrying bag or something to keep all the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gardner

It has a soft grip handle that provides added comfort during use and a light weight to prevent user fatigue. This drill is ideal for drilling and screwdriving through wood, metal, and plastic.
